title: Analysis of composite function part - d

content.description: Let f be a twice-differentiable function such that f(2)=5 and f(5)=2. Let g be the function given by g(x)=f(f(x)).
content.question: Let h(x)=f(x)-x. Explain why there must be a value r for 2<r<5 such that h(r)=0.

frqParts.text: Let h(x)=f(x)-x. Explain why there must be a value r for 2<r<5 such that h(r)=0.

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
